oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Binding studies of diorganochalcogenides with Hg(II) in solution
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RAKESH, P
SINGH, HB
JASINSKI, JP
GOLEN, JA
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: MONOMERIC SELENOLATO COMPLEXES
HG2+ IONS
METHYLMERCURY TOXICITY
ORGANOCHALCOGEN SE
CRYSTAL-STRUCTURE
TE COMPOUNDS
MERCURY
FLUORESCENT
CHEMODOSIMETER

Organotelluride
Selective recognition of He2+
Fluorescence quenching
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A series of organochalcogen tridentate ligands containing N, Se/Te, N donor atoms has been synthesized. Three fluorophore ligands show that Hg2+ ions can be selectively detected in the presence of different interfering cations, that is, Zn2+, Cd2+, Cu2+, Co2+, Ni2+, Ca2+, Na+, K+ and Ag+.
